Overview Description:

  In the 'SWT Controls' view of the SWT Examples software,
  under the ?Table? tab, table widget item color changes fail after the 
  first item color change.  The failure includes the disappearance
  of the item entry in the table, and an ?unhandled exception in
  event loop? error. 

Steps to reproduce:

1.	Open the ?Table? tab of the ?SWT Controls? view
2.	Check SWT.FULL_SELECTION under the ?Styles? options
3.	Select a Table widget row item
4.	Select the ?Item foreground? color button
5.	Select a non-?black? color from the color selection dialog, and apply 
the color change
6.	Select a second Table widget row item
7.	(NOTE: At this point the previous item changes to the selected color)
8.	Select the ?Item foreground? color button
9.	Select a non-?black? color from the color selection dialog, and apply 
the color change
  !BUG! The following Java error is output on the ?Unix? command terminal where
        Eclipse was started:

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Argument not valid

10.	Select additional row items in the Table widget
! BUG !  Subsequent table row selections make the row content disappear.

------
Build 2002-11-07-1448 on Solaris (also occurs on HPUX)

Grant to investigate and advise

Verified this happens on Linux Motif I20021126. Ok on GTK and Windows.

I got the following stack trace:

Fixed > 1204.  The emulated TableItem and TreeItem were storing received Colors 
for later use, which is bad since the client can dispose of these Colors at any 
point.

Correction: The problem was actually in the ControlExample, and it happened to 
not crash on win32 and gtk by fluke, not by design.  So the fix has been 
changed accordingly.

This has been retested in M5 (build 200302061700), and it appears to have been 
fixed.

As Rodrigo Geve is no longer working with Rational, I have been assigned all of 
his bugs. Please mark this bug as VERIFIED or CLOSED, as I am unable to do so. 
Thanks.
